examplesSection.title: Interactive Examples
examplesSection.description: Explore WSXJS capabilities with these interactive examples. See how easy it is to build powerful web components.

coreFeatures.title: Core Component Types
coreFeatures.subtitle: These are the fundamental building blocks of WSXJS. Master these to unlock the full power of the framework.

router.title: üß≠ Router Navigation
router.description: Navigate between sections using WSX Router components

webComponent.title: üåê WebComponent Examples
webComponent.description: Complete WebComponent examples with Shadow DOM. Includes TodoList (array reactive) and UserProfile (object reactive) components. Demonstrates full @state decorator capabilities with automatic rerender.

lightComponent.title: üí° LightComponent Examples
lightComponent.description: Complete LightComponent examples without Shadow DOM. Includes TodoListLight (array reactive) and UserProfileLight (object reactive) components. Styles can be inherited from parent for easier theming.

slots.title: üéØ Slot Examples
slots.description: Learn how to use slots in both WebComponent (Shadow DOM) and LightComponent (Light DOM). Includes named slots, default slots, and mixed usage scenarios where components are nested.

svg.title: SVG Graphics
svg.description: Native SVG support with namespace handling and animations

colorPicker.title: Color Picker
colorPicker.description: Custom web component with color selection and state management

editorjs.title: üìù EditorJS Plugin Demo
editorjs.description: Build EditorJS plugins with WSX components for better developer experience
editorjs.link: ‚Üí Visit the EditorJS Demo page to try it out

featuresSection.title: Why Choose WSXJS?
featuresSection.description: Built for modern web development with a focus on simplicity, performance, and developer experience.

approachable.title: Approachable
approachable.description: Builds on top of standard Web Components with intuitive JSX syntax and world-class TypeScript support. Easy to learn and use.

performant.title: Performant
performant.description: Zero dependencies, native DOM operations, and compiler-optimized rendering system that rarely requires manual optimization.

versatile.title: Versatile
versatile.description: A rich, incrementally adoptable ecosystem that scales from simple components to full-featured applications.

quickStartSection.title: Quick Start
quickStartSection.description: Get started with WSXJS in minutes. Create your first web component with JSX syntax and TypeScript support.

installation.title: Installation

create.title: Create
create.description: Create your first component with JSX

build.title: Build
build.description: Build and deploy your web components

router.title: üöÄ Router Example
router.description: This page demonstrates WSX Router in action! Notice how:

points.highlight: Navigation links highlight the active page
points.sections: Each section is a separate component loaded by route

quickStartCode.title: Get Started in 60 Seconds
quickStartCode.description: Install WSXJS and create your first component in less than a minute.

performanceMetrics.title: Performance
performanceMetrics.description: WSXJS delivers native performance with zero runtime overhead. No Virtual DOM, no framework overhead, just pure Web Components.

runtimeSize.label: Runtime Size
runtimeSize.description: No runtime library, pure build-time transformation

nativePerformance.label: Native Performance
nativePerformance.description: Direct DOM manipulation, no Virtual DOM overhead

webComponentExamples.title: WebComponent Examples
webComponentExamples.description: Explore WebComponent examples with Shadow DOM and @state decorator support. These components demonstrate reactive state management with arrays and objects.

todoList.title: üìã Todo List
todoList.description: Demonstrates @state decorator with arrays in WebComponent. Shows add, remove, update, and filter operations with automatic reactive updates. Uses Shadow DOM for style isolation.

userProfile.title: üë§ User Profile
userProfile.description: Demonstrates @state decorator with objects in WebComponent. Shows object property updates, nested object updates, and entire object replacement with automatic reactive updates. Uses Shadow DOM for style isolation.

shadowDOM.label: Shadow DOM:
shadowDOM.description: Complete style isolation from parent page

arraySupport.label: Array Support:
arraySupport.description: Full array mutation methods trigger rerender

objectSupport.label: Object Support:
objectSupport.description: Object property updates and replacement trigger rerender

automaticRerender.label: Automatic Rerender:
automaticRerender.description: State changes automatically trigger component rerender

lightComponentExamples.title: LightComponent Examples
lightComponentExamples.description: Explore LightComponent examples without Shadow DOM. These components demonstrate reactive state management with arrays and objects, with styles that can be inherited from parent pages.

todoList.title: üìã Todo List
todoList.description: Demonstrates @state decorator with arrays in LightComponent. Shows add, remove, update, and filter operations with automatic reactive updates. Uses Light DOM - styles can be inherited from parent.

userProfile.title: üë§ User Profile
userProfile.description: Demonstrates @state decorator with objects in LightComponent. Shows object property updates, nested object updates, and entire object replacement with automatic reactive updates. Uses Light DOM - styles can be inherited from parent.

lightDOM.label: Light DOM:
lightDOM.description: No Shadow DOM - styles can be inherited from parent

arraySupport.label: Array Support:
arraySupport.description: Full array mutation methods trigger rerender

objectSupport.label: Object Support:
objectSupport.description: Object property updates and replacement trigger rerender

automaticRerender.label: Automatic Rerender:
automaticRerender.description: State changes automatically trigger component rerender

styleInheritance.label: Style Inheritance:
styleInheritance.description: Can use CSS from parent page for easier theming

slotExamples.title: Slot Examples
slotExamples.description: Explore slot usage in WebComponent (Shadow DOM) and LightComponent (Light DOM), including mixed usage scenarios.

webComponent.title: üéØ WebComponent Slot (Shadow DOM)
webComponent.description: Demonstrates slot usage in WebComponent with Shadow DOM. Slots allow you to project content from Light DOM into Shadow DOM. Use ::slotted() CSS selector to style slotted content.
webComponent.content: This is the main content in a WebComponent slot.
webComponent.content2: Slots work perfectly in Shadow DOM!

lightComponent.title: üí° LightComponent Slot (Light DOM)
lightComponent.description: Demonstrates slot usage in LightComponent with Light DOM. Slots work similarly, but content is in Light DOM, making it accessible to third-party libraries like Editor.js.
lightComponent.content: This is the main content in a LightComponent slot.
lightComponent.content2: Slots work in Light DOM too!

mixedWebToLight.title: üîÄ Mixed: WebComponent ‚Üí LightComponent Slot
mixedWebToLight.description: WebComponent (Shadow DOM) containing LightComponent (Light DOM) with slots. The LightComponent's slot content comes from the WebComponent's render method. This demonstrates how slots work when components are nested.
mixedWebToLight.content: This LightComponent is rendered inside a WebComponent (SlotExamples).
mixedWebToLight.content2: The slot content is projected from WebComponent's Shadow DOM to LightComponent's Light DOM!

mixedLightToWeb.title: üîÄ Mixed: LightComponent ‚Üí WebComponent Slot
mixedLightToWeb.description: LightComponent (Light DOM) containing WebComponent (Shadow DOM) with slots. The WebComponent's slot content comes from the LightComponent's render method. This demonstrates how slots work across Shadow DOM boundaries.
mixedLightToWeb.content: This WebComponent is rendered inside a LightComponent (App).
mixedLightToWeb.content2: The slot content is projected from LightComponent's Light DOM to WebComponent's Shadow DOM!

namedSlots.label: Named Slots:
namedSlots.description: Use slot="name" to project content to specific slots

defaultSlot.label: Default Slot:
defaultSlot.description: Content without slot attribute goes to the default slot

shadowDOMSlots.label: Shadow DOM Slots:
shadowDOMSlots.description: Use ::slotted() CSS selector to style slotted content

lightDOMSlots.label: Light DOM Slots:
lightDOMSlots.description: Slots work in Light DOM, making content accessible to third-party libraries

mixedUsage.label: Mixed Usage:
mixedUsage.description: You can nest WebComponent and LightComponent with slots

smartRendering.label: Smart Rendering:
smartRendering.description: Our optimized connectedCallback ensures slots work correctly even when components are moved
